intro: Acosta chaubardii, commonly known as the Chaubard's acosta, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the understory of tropical forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
